items.title: Tech's top venture firm tried to stay above politics, then a partner created a furor
items.summary: Sequoia Capital's managing partner faced questions about a colleague's controversial statements, causing a political uproar within the firm

items.title: Jensen Huang, AI visionary in a leather jacket
items.summary: Jensen Huang, previously unknown to the general public, has become a powerful entrepreneur leading chip giant Nvidia, with their essential GPUs used in AI applications.

items.title: aiwand 0.4.15
items.summary: aiwand 0.4.15 is a simple AI toolkit for text processing that utilizes OpenAI and Gemini APIs.

items.title: Experienced software developers assumed AI would save them a chunk of time. But in one experiment, their tasks took 20% longer
items.summary: Experienced software developers found that AI tools did not save them time in one experiment, with tasks taking 20% longer to complete. A new study from Model Evaluation and Threat Research showed that developers took longer to perform tasks using AI tools compared to when they were not using the technology.

items.title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang Charms China With AI Diplomacy as Tariff Tensions Linger
items.summary: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang promoted cooperation in AI at China International Supply Chain Expo amidst ongoing trade tensions between US and China.

items.title: Nvidia's CUDA platform now supports RISC-V — support brings open source instruction set to AI platforms, joining x86 and Arm
items.summary: Nvidia's CUDA platform now supports RISC-V, bringing the open source instruction set to AI platforms and potentially positioning it as a host processor for future AI and HPC systems.

items.title: Automate Your Design Workflow: The AI-Powered Creative Cloud Pro Method
items.summary: Automate Your Design Workflow: The AI-Powered Creative Cloud Pro Method aims to streamline the design process by using AI to handle repetitive tasks, allowing designers to focus more on creative aspects. This innovation addresses the paradox of design careers that involve a significant amount of non-creative work.

items.title: Nvidia Will Continue Controlling The AI Board
items.summary: Nvidia maintains control over the AI board, leading the ecosystem with strong growth and dominance in hardware, software, and systems, making NVDA stock a buy.

items.title: AI might be the best thing to happen to design communication
items.summary: AI might be the best thing to happen to design communication, as its value has often been measured by what can be seen, not necessarily explained. The right layout, contrast ratio, and balance of form and whitespace are crucial.

items.title: What’s next for Laurienté after collapsed Sunderland transfer?
items.summary: Armand Laurienté's proposed Sunderland transfer has collapsed, but the French winger is unlikely to remain at Sassuolo as he wants a new challenge.

items.title: ai-doc-generator added to PyPI
items.summary: ai-doc-generator, an AI-powered documentation generator for Python projects using OpenAI, has been added to PyPI.

items.title: Designing products is easy. Designing peace of mind is hard.
items.summary: Designing products is easy. Designing peace of mind is hard. - Last week, I had lunch with a man who once managed over 1,000 designers across multiple continents.

items.title: A MAGA bot network on X is divided over the Trump-Epstein backlash
items.summary: A network of AI-powered bots on X is being used to reply to conservatives with positive messages about people in the Trump administration, which raises concerns about the ethical implications of using AI to manipulate public opinion.

items.title: How Distillation Makes AI Models Smaller and Cheaper
items.summary: The Chinese AI company DeepSeek released a chatbot called R1 with impressive performance, drawing significant attention. The company's use of distillation techniques to make AI models smaller and cheaper was a key focus in discussions around the chatbot's capabilities.

items.title: Experienced software developers assumed AI would save them a chunk of time. But in one experiment, their tasks took 20% longer
items.summary: Experienced software developers found that tasks took 20% longer with AI, contradicting assumptions that it would save time. A new study highlights how AI doesn't always deliver promised boosts in productivity.

items.title: Experienced software developers assumed AI would save them a chunk of time. But in one experiment, their tasks took 20% longer
items.summary: Experienced software developers found that AI did not save them time in one experiment, with tasks actually taking 20% longer. This adds to evidence that AI may not always boost productivity as promised.

items.title: Google launches Gemini Drops to keep you on top of the latest AI features - Android Police
items.summary: Google launches Gemini Drops to keep you on top of the latest AI features for Workspace apps, providing a quick and easy assist.

items.title: Top Wall Street analysts are confident about the potential of these 3 stocks
items.summary: Top Wall Street analysts are confident about the potential of three stocks, including Uber Technologies and Alphabet, favored by Wall Street.

items.summary: How to Limit Galaxy AI to On-Device Processing—or Turn It Off Altogether - You don’t have to accept the AI that Samsung offers you.

items.title: Cursor AI is not preserving the state when I restart the laptop
items.summary: Cursor AI software installed on Ubuntu is not preserving the state, such as recently opened projects, after a laptop restart despite reinstalling the appimage from the Cursor website.

items.title: Digital vassals? French Government 'exposes citizens' data to US'
items.summary: French Government's reliance on US tech giants raises concerns about digital sovereignty and exposes citizens' data to foreign jurisdictions.

items.title: Indian-Origin Trapit Bansal, Hammad Syed Among 44 Picked For Meta’s Superintelligence Unit
items.summary: Indian-Origin Trapit Bansal and Hammad Syed are among 44 individuals selected for Meta's Superintelligence Unit, demonstrating Meta's commitment to advancing AI technology by hiring talent from top organizations such as OpenAI and Google Deepmind.

items.title: How to Spot a Deepfake Job Application
items.summary: Research firm Gartner predicts that by 2028, 25 percent of job candidates will be fake, created largely by AI

items.title: My interview was on March 21, 1977, day Emergency was revoked: Jaishankar recalls UPSC journey
items.summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reflected on his UPSC interview held on the day Emergency was lifted, emphasizing the importance of effective communication under pressure. He compared the UPSC exam to a trial by fire, highlighting the ethical responsibilities of civil servants.

items.title: Parasite's Director Thinks This Steven Spielberg Sci-Fi Hit Is One Of This Century's Best Movies
items.summary: Parasite director Bong Joon Ho includes a Steven Spielberg sci-fi movie in his picks for the best films of the 21st century.

items.title: AAPL SECURITIES NEWS: Did Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) Commit Securities Fraud? Contact BFA Law by August 19 Class Action Deadline
items.summary: Apple Inc. investors are being notified to contact BFA Law before the August 19, 2025 securities fraud class action deadline, raising concerns about potential securities fraud committed by Apple Inc.

items.title: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns of AI superintelligence outpacing Earth's energy limits: 'Chips will outrun power needs'
items.summary: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns of AI superintelligence potentially outpacing Earth's energy limits, as data centers fueling AI models consume record amounts of water and electricity. This raises concerns about an environmental crisis and the need to address the power requirements of advancing AI technology.

items.title: 'Baby Grok': Elon Musk stuns internet with kids-friendly AI app announcement after explicit avatar uproar
items.summary: Elon Musk announced plans to release a kids-friendly AI app called Baby Grok, a version of the AI chatbot Grok, after facing criticism for an explicit avatar. The app will be dedicated to being kid-friendly.

items.title: A MAGA bot network on X is divided over the Trump-Epstein backlash
items.summary: A bot network on X is using AI to reply to conservatives with positive messages about people in the Trump administration, sparking division over the Trump-Epstein backlash.

items.title: Schlumberger: A Strong Buy For Value And Income Investors
items.summary: Schlumberger's AI-driven digital initiatives are providing powerful tailwinds for sustained earnings expansion, making it a strong buy for value and income investors in the oil industry.

items.title: Why AI is moving from chatbots to the browser - The Verge
items.summary: AI is transitioning from chatbots to the browser, signaling a shift in the web's business model to adapt to the AI age. This change is predicted to alter the internet as we know it, with advancements like Web 4.0 on the horizon.

items.title: If you think electric bikes are bad, there’s a much bigger menace hitting our roads
items.summary: Electric bikes are seen as a menace on the roads due to their speed, quietness, and popularity among teenagers, raising ethical concerns about safety and regulation.

items.title: Show HN: Hybrid Knowledge Graph and RAG for Legal Documents (Learning Project)
items.summary: Built a hybrid knowledge graph and RAG system for legal documents to address the limitations of traditional RAG in capturing interconnections between sections. The system combines both approaches on every query for better semantic understanding.

items.title: Show HN: Gix – A small CLI tool that adds AI to Git
items.summary: Gix is a small CLI tool that adds AI to Git, helping split large diffs into smaller commits and suggesting conventional commit messages. It is written in Go, cross-platform, and fully local.

items.title: RDDT SECURITIES NEWS: Did Reddit, Inc. (NYSE:RDDT) Commit Securities Fraud? Contact BFA Law by August 18 Class Action Deadline
items.summary: Investors in Reddit, Inc. are notified to contact BFA Law before August 18 class action deadline for alleged securities fraud.

items.title: White goods makers hope to make up for dull first half with festival season sales
items.summary: White goods makers are looking to boost sales during the festival season to make up for a slow first half, with expectations of up to 40% growth. They plan to introduce new models and financing options to attract more customers.

items.summary: India has doubled the number of Interpol Red Notices since 2023 with the help of the Central Bureau of Investigation, showing a focus on actively pursuing fugitives abroad.

items.summary: DuckDuckGo now allows users to block AI-generated images in an attempt to reduce exposure to misleading or unsolicited visuals.

items.summary: Elon Musk faces criticism for overseeing massive spending cuts as head of Department of Government Efficiency, causing concern within scientific community. He continues to support president Donald Trump, a climate change denier.
